43const double LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::DEFAULT_FEATURE_ANGLE = 2. * BITPIT_PI;
44
48LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo()
49 : m_surface(nullptr),
50 m_featureAngle(0)
51{
52}
53
57LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo(const LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo &other)
58 : m_surface(other.m_surface),
59 m_featureAngle(other.m_featureAngle),
60 m_segmentVertexOffset(other.m_segmentVertexOffset),
61 m_segmentNormalsValid(other.m_segmentNormalsValid),
62 m_segmentNormalsStorage(other.m_segmentNormalsStorage),
63 m_unlimitedVertexNormalsValid(other.m_unlimitedVertexNormalsValid),
64 m_unlimitedVertexNormalsStorage(other.m_unlimitedVertexNormalsStorage),
65 m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalValid(other.m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalValid),
66 m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalStorage(other.m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalStorage)
67{
68 if (other.m_ownedSurface) {
69 m_ownedSurface = std::unique_ptr<SurfUnstructured>(new SurfUnstructured(*(other.m_ownedSurface)));
70 } else {
71 m_ownedSurface = nullptr;
72 }
73
74 if (other.m_searchTree) {
75 m_searchTree = std::unique_ptr<SurfaceSkdTree>(new SurfaceSkdTree(m_surface));
76 m_searchTree->build();
77 } else {
78 m_searchTree = nullptr;
79 }
80}
81
88LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo(std::unique_ptr<const SurfUnstructured> &&surface, double featureAngle ) {
89
90 setSurface(std::move(surface), featureAngle);
91}
92
99LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo(const SurfUnstructured *surface, double featureAngle ) {
100
101 setSurface(surface, featureAngle);
102}
103
108const SurfUnstructured & LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::getSurface() const {
109 return *m_surface;
110}
111
117void LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::setSurface(std::unique_ptr<const SurfUnstructured> &&surface, double featureAngle){
118
119 m_ownedSurface = std::move(surface);
120 setSurface(m_ownedSurface.get(), featureAngle);
121}
122
128void LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::setSurface(const SurfUnstructured *surface, double featureAngle){
129
130 // Check if adjacencies are built
131 if (surface->getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == SurfUnstructured::ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
132 throw std::runtime_error ("Segmentation needs adjacencies!") ;
133 }
134
135 // Surface information
136 m_surface = surface;
137 m_featureAngle = featureAngle;
138
139 // Segment vertices information
140 m_segmentVertexOffset.unsetKernel();
141 m_segmentVertexOffset.setStaticKernel(&m_surface->getCells());
142
143 std::size_t nTotalSegmentVertices = 0;
144 for (auto itr = m_segmentVertexOffset.begin(); itr != m_segmentVertexOffset.end(); ++itr) {
145 *itr = nTotalSegmentVertices;
146 nTotalSegmentVertices += m_surface->getCells().rawAt(itr.getRawIndex()).getVertexCount();
147 }
148
149 // Normals
150 m_segmentNormalsValid.unsetKernel();
151 m_segmentNormalsValid.setStaticKernel(&m_surface->getCells());
152 m_segmentNormalsValid.fill(false);
153 m_segmentNormalsStorage.unsetKernel();
154 m_segmentNormalsStorage.setStaticKernel(&m_surface->getCells());
155
156 m_unlimitedVertexNormalsValid.unsetKernel();
157 m_unlimitedVertexNormalsValid.setStaticKernel(&m_surface->getVertices());
158 m_unlimitedVertexNormalsValid.fill(false);
159 m_unlimitedVertexNormalsStorage.unsetKernel();
160 m_unlimitedVertexNormalsStorage.setStaticKernel(&m_surface->getVertices());
161
162 m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalValid.assign(nTotalSegmentVertices, false);
163
164 // Initialize search tree
165 m_searchTree = std::unique_ptr<SurfaceSkdTree>(new SurfaceSkdTree(surface));
166 m_searchTree->build();
167}
168
173const SurfaceSkdTree & LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::getSearchTree() const {
174 return *m_searchTree;
175}
176
181double LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::getFeatureAngle() const {
182 return m_featureAngle;
183}
184
193double LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::evalDistance(const std::array<double, 3> &point,
194 const SegmentConstIterator &segmentItr,
195 bool signedDistance) const
196{
197 // Project the point on the surface and evaluate the point-projection vector
198 int nSegmentVertices = segmentItr->getVertexCount();
199 BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(lambda, double, nSegmentVertices, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_VERTICES);
200 std::array<double, 3> pointProjection = evalProjection(point, segmentItr, lambda);
201 std::array<double, 3> pointProjectionVector = point - pointProjection;
202
203 // Evaluate unsigned distance
204 double unsignedDistance = norm2(pointProjectionVector);
205 if (!signedDistance) {
206 return unsignedDistance;
207 }
208
209 // Signed distance
210 //
211 // If the sign is null and the point doesn't lie on the segmentation, it lies on the normal
212 // plane. This case is not supported, because it would require to evaluate the sign taking
213 // into account the the curvature of the surface.
214 std::array<double, 3> pseudoNormal = computePseudoNormal(segmentItr, lambda);
215 double pointProjectionNormalComponent = dotProduct(pointProjectionVector, pseudoNormal);
216
217 double distanceTolerance = m_surface->getTol();
218 if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(pointProjectionNormalComponent, 0., distanceTolerance, distanceTolerance)) {
219 bool pointOnSegmentation = utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(unsignedDistance, 0., distanceTolerance, distanceTolerance);
220 if (!pointOnSegmentation) {
221 throw std::runtime_error("Unable to evaluate point sign: the point lies on the normal plane!");
222 }
223 }
224
225 return sign(pointProjectionNormalComponent) * unsignedDistance;
226}
227
235std::array<double, 3> LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::evalDistanceVector(const std::array<double, 3> &point,
236 const SegmentConstIterator &segmentItr) const
237{
238 int nSegmentVertices = segmentItr->getVertexCount();
239 BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(lambda, double, nSegmentVertices, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_VERTICES);
240 std::array<double, 3> pointProjection = evalProjection(point, segmentItr, lambda);
241
242 return (point - pointProjection);
243}
244
252std::array<double, 3> LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::evalNormal(const std::array<double, 3> &point,
253 const SegmentConstIterator &segmentItr) const
254{
255 // Project the point on the surface and evaluate the point-projection vector
256 int nSegmentVertices = segmentItr->getVertexCount();
257 BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(lambda, double, nSegmentVertices, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_VERTICES);
258 evalProjection(point, segmentItr, lambda);
259
260 // Evaluate normal
261 return computeSurfaceNormal(segmentItr, lambda);
262}
263
272std::array<double, 3> LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::evalProjection(const std::array<double, 3> &point,
273 const SegmentConstIterator &segmentItr,
274 double *lambda) const
275{
276 const Cell &segment = *segmentItr;
277 ElementType segmentType = segment.getType();
278 switch (segmentType) {
279
280 case ElementType::VERTEX :
281 {
282 ConstProxyVector<long> segmentVertexIds = segment.getVertexIds();
283 long id = segmentVertexIds[0];
284 lambda[0] = 1.;
285 return m_surface->getVertexCoords(id);
286 }
287
288 case ElementType::LINE:
289 {
290 ConstProxyVector<long> segmentVertexIds = segment.getVertexIds();
291 long id0 = segmentVertexIds[0];
292 long id1 = segmentVertexIds[1];
293 return CGElem::projectPointSegment(point, m_surface->getVertexCoords(id0), m_surface->getVertexCoords(id1), lambda);
294 }
295
296 case ElementType::TRIANGLE:
297 {
298 ConstProxyVector<long> segmentVertexIds = segment.getVertexIds();
299 long id0 = segmentVertexIds[0];
300 long id1 = segmentVertexIds[1];
301 long id2 = segmentVertexIds[2];
302 return CGElem::projectPointTriangle(point, m_surface->getVertexCoords(id0), m_surface->getVertexCoords(id1), m_surface->getVertexCoords(id2), lambda);
303 }
304
305 default:
306 {
307 ConstProxyVector<long> segmentVertexIds = m_surface->getFacetOrderedVertexIds(segment);
308 std::size_t nSegmentVertices = segmentVertexIds.size();
309 BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(segmentVertexCoors, std::array<double BITPIT_COMMA 3>, nSegmentVertices, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_VERTICES);
310 m_surface->getVertexCoords(segmentVertexIds.size(), segmentVertexIds.data(), segmentVertexCoors);
311 return CGElem::projectPointPolygon(point, nSegmentVertices, segmentVertexCoors, lambda);
312 }
313
314 }
315}
316
339std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::computePseudoNormal(const SegmentConstIterator &segmentItr,
340 const double *lambda ) const
341{
342 // Early return if the segment is a point
343 const Cell &segment = *segmentItr;
344 ElementType segmentType = segment.getType();
345 if (segmentType == ElementType::VERTEX) {
346 return {{0., 0., 0.}};
347 }
348
349 // Evaluate pseudo normal
350 int positionFlag;
351 if (segmentType == ElementType::LINE) {
352 positionFlag = CGElem::convertBarycentricToFlagSegment(lambda, m_surface->getTol());
353 } else {
354 int nSegmentVertices = segment.getVertexCount();
355 positionFlag = CGElem::convertBarycentricToFlagPolygon(nSegmentVertices, lambda, m_surface->getTol());
356 if (positionFlag > 0) {
357 int polygonVertex = positionFlag - 1;
358 int elementVertex = m_surface->getFacetOrderedLocalVertex(segment, polygonVertex);
359
360 positionFlag = elementVertex + 1;
361 } else if (positionFlag < 0) {
362 int polygonEdge = (- positionFlag) - 1;
363 int elementEdge = m_surface->getFacetOrderedLocalEdge(segment, polygonEdge);
364
365 positionFlag = - (elementEdge + 1);
366 }
367 }
368
369 std::array<double,3> pseudoNormal;
370 if (positionFlag == 0) {
371 pseudoNormal = computeSegmentNormal(segmentItr);
372 } else if (positionFlag > 0) {
373 int vertex = positionFlag - 1;
374 pseudoNormal = computeSegmentVertexNormal(segmentItr, vertex, false);
375 } else {
376 int edge = (- positionFlag) - 1;
377 pseudoNormal = computeSegmentEdgeNormal(segmentItr, edge);
378 }
379
380 return pseudoNormal;
381}
382
395std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::computeSurfaceNormal(const SegmentConstIterator &segmentItr,
396 const double *lambda ) const
397{
398 // Early return if the segment is a point
399 const Cell &segment = *segmentItr;
400 ElementType segmentType = segment.getType();
401 if (segmentType == ElementType::VERTEX) {
402 return {{0., 0., 0.}};
403 }
404
405 // Evaluate surface normal
406 std::size_t nSegmentVertices = segment.getVertexCount();
407 std::array<double,3> surfaceNormal = lambda[0] * computeSegmentVertexNormal(segmentItr, 0, true);
408 for (std::size_t i = 1; i < nSegmentVertices; ++i) {
409 surfaceNormal += lambda[i] * computeSegmentVertexNormal(segmentItr, i, true);
410 }
411 surfaceNormal /= norm2(surfaceNormal);
412
413 return surfaceNormal;
414}
415
424std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::computeSegmentNormal(const SegmentConstIterator &segmentItr ) const {
425
426 std::size_t segmentRawId = segmentItr.getRawIndex();
427 std::array<double, 3> *segmentNormal = m_segmentNormalsStorage.rawData(segmentRawId);
428 if (!m_segmentNormalsValid.rawAt(segmentRawId)) {
429 *segmentNormal = m_surface->evalFacetNormal(segmentItr->getId());
430 m_segmentNormalsValid.rawAt(segmentRawId) = true;
431 }
432
433 return *segmentNormal;
434}
435
445std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::computeSegmentEdgeNormal(const SegmentConstIterator &segmentItr, int edge ) const {
446
447 std::array<double,3> normal = computeSegmentNormal(segmentItr);
448
449 if (segmentItr->getAdjacencyCount(edge) > 0) {
450 long neighId = segmentItr->getAdjacency(edge);
451 SegmentConstIterator neighIterator = m_surface->getCellConstIterator(neighId);
452
453 normal += computeSegmentNormal(neighIterator);
454 normal /= norm2(normal);
455 }
456
457 return normal;
458}
459
471std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::computeSegmentVertexNormal(const SegmentConstIterator &segmentItr, int vertex, bool limited ) const {
472
473 // Segment information
474 long segmentId = segmentItr.getId();
475 long segmentRawId = segmentItr.getRawIndex();
476 const Cell &segment = *segmentItr;
477
478 // Update the cache
479 //
480 // Cache is updated for all the vertices of the segment.
481 long vertexId = segment.getVertexId(vertex);
482 std::size_t vertexRawId = m_surface->getVertices().getRawIndex(vertexId);
483 bool hasUnlimitedNormal = m_unlimitedVertexNormalsValid.rawAt(vertexRawId);
484
485 bool hasLimitedNormal = m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalValid[m_segmentVertexOffset.rawAt(segmentRawId) + vertex];
486
487 if (!hasUnlimitedNormal || !hasLimitedNormal) {
488 static std::vector<long> vertexNeighbours;
489 vertexNeighbours.clear();
490 m_surface->findCellVertexNeighs(segmentId, vertex, &vertexNeighbours);
491
492 std::array<double, 3> limitedVertexNormal;
493 std::array<double, 3> unlimitedVertexNormal;
494 if (hasUnlimitedNormal) {
495 limitedVertexNormal = m_surface->evalLimitedVertexNormal(segmentId, vertex, vertexNeighbours.size(), vertexNeighbours.data(), m_featureAngle) ;
496 unlimitedVertexNormal = m_unlimitedVertexNormalsStorage.rawAt(vertexRawId);
497 } else {
498 m_surface->evalVertexNormals(segmentId, vertex, vertexNeighbours.size(), vertexNeighbours.data(), m_featureAngle, &unlimitedVertexNormal, &limitedVertexNormal) ;
499 }
500
501 // Store vertex limited normal
502 //
503 // Both limited and unlimited normal are evaluated, however limited
504 // normal is only stored if its misalignment with respect to the
505 // unlimited normal is greater than a defined tolerance.
506 if (!hasLimitedNormal) {
507 double misalignment = norm2(unlimitedVertexNormal - limitedVertexNormal) ;
508 if (misalignment >= m_surface->getTol()) {
509 std::pair<long, int> segmentVertexKey = std::make_pair(segmentId, vertex);
510 m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalStorage.insert({segmentVertexKey, std::move(limitedVertexNormal)}) ;
511 }
512 m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalValid[m_segmentVertexOffset.rawAt(segmentRawId) + vertex] = true;
513 }
514
515 // Store vertex unlimited normal
516 if (!hasUnlimitedNormal ) {
517 m_unlimitedVertexNormalsStorage.rawAt(vertexRawId) = std::move(unlimitedVertexNormal);
518 m_unlimitedVertexNormalsValid.rawAt(vertexRawId) = true ;
519 }
520 }
521
522 // Get the normal from the cache
523 if (limited) {
524 std::pair<long, int> segmentVertexKey = std::make_pair(segmentId, vertex);
525 auto limitedSegmentVertexNormal = m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalStorage.find(segmentVertexKey);
526 if (limitedSegmentVertexNormal != m_limitedSegmentVertexNormalStorage.end()) {
527 return limitedSegmentVertexNormal->second;
528 }
529 }
530
531 return m_unlimitedVertexNormalsStorage.rawAt(vertexRawId);
532}
533
546const double LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::AUTOMATIC_SEARCH_RADIUS = -1;
547
554std::size_t LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::createFieldCellCache(LevelSetField field)
555{
556 switch(field) {
557
558 case LevelSetField::SUPPORT:
559 return createFieldCellCache<long>(field);
560
561 default:
562 return LevelSetObject::createFieldCellCache(field);
563
564 }
565}
566
571LevelSetFieldset LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::getSupportedFields() const
572{
573 LevelSetFieldset supportedFields = LevelSetObject::getSupportedFields();
574 supportedFields.push_back(LevelSetField::PART);
575 supportedFields.push_back(LevelSetField::NORMAL);
576 supportedFields.push_back(LevelSetField::SUPPORT);
577
578 return supportedFields;
579}
580
587void LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::fillFieldCellCache(LevelSetField field, long id)
588{
589 switch (field) {
590
591 case LevelSetField::SUPPORT:
592 evalCellSupport(id);
593 break;
594
595 default:
596 LevelSetObject::fillFieldCellCache(field, id);
597
598 }
599}
600
607const SurfUnstructured & LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::evalCellSurface(long id) const
608{
609 return _evalCellSurface(id);
610}
611
618int LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::evalCellPart(long id) const
619{
620 auto evaluator = [this] (long id)
621 {
622 return _evalCellPart(id);
623 };
624
625 auto fallback = [] (long id)
626 {
627 BITPIT_UNUSED(id);
628
629 return levelSetDefaults::PART;
630 };
631
632 LevelSetField field = LevelSetField::PART;
633 int part = evalCellFieldCached<int>(field, id, evaluator, fallback);
634
635 return part;
636}
637
673LevelSetIntersectionStatus LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::_intersectSurface(long id, double distance, LevelSetIntersectionMode mode) const
674{
675 // Get surface information
676 const SurfUnstructured &surface = evalCellSurface(id);
677
678 // Early return if the surface is empty
679 if (surface.empty()) {
680 return LevelSetIntersectionStatus::FALSE;
681 }
682
683 // Evaluate intersection using base class
684 return LevelSetObject::_intersectSurface(id, distance, mode);
685}
686
694std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::evalCellNormal(long id, bool signedLevelSet) const
695{
696 // Evaluate signed normal
697 //
698 // The normal stored in the cache is unsigned.
699 auto evaluator = [this] (long id)
700 {
701 return _evalCellNormal(id, false);
702 };
703
704 auto fallback = [] (long id)
705 {
706 BITPIT_UNUSED(id);
707
708 return levelSetDefaults::NORMAL;
709 };
710
711 LevelSetField field = LevelSetField::NORMAL;
712 std::array<double, 3> normal = evalCellFieldCached<std::array<double, 3>>(field, id, evaluator, fallback);
713
714 // Evaluate the normal with the correct signdness
715 //
716 // If an unsigned evaluation is requested, the orientation of the surface should be discarded
717 // and in order to have a normal that is agnostic with respect the two sides of the surface.
718 if (signedLevelSet) {
719 short cellSign = evalCellSign(id);
720 if (cellSign <= 0) {
721 normal *= static_cast<double>(cellSign);;
722 }
723 }
724
725 return normal;
726}
727
742long LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::evalCellSupport(long id, double searchRadius) const
743{
744 // Evaluate support
745 //
746 // If we are using a limited search radius, it is not possible to use the support stored
747 // in the cache, because it may be outside the search radius.
748 auto evaluator = [this, searchRadius] (long id)
749 {
750 // Evaluate the search radius for support evaluation
751 //
752 // For the automatic evaluation of the search range, it is possible to use the
753 // information about the cell zone:
754 // - cells that are inside the narrow band because their distance from the surface is
755 // less than the narrow band size can use a search radius equal to the narrow band
756 // size
757 // - cells that are inside the narrow band because they intersects the surface can use
758 // a search radius equal to their bounding radius;
759 // - cells that are inside the narrow band because their one of their face neighbours
760 // intersect the surface can use a search radius equal to their bounding radius plus
761 // the bounding diameter of the smallest neighbour that intersects the surface.
762 double supportSearchRadius;
763 if (searchRadius == AUTOMATIC_SEARCH_RADIUS) {
764 LevelSetCellLocation cellLocation = getCellLocation(id);
765 if (cellLocation == LevelSetCellLocation::NARROW_BAND_DISTANCE) {
766 supportSearchRadius = this->m_narrowBandSize;
767 } else if (cellLocation == LevelSetCellLocation::NARROW_BAND_INTERSECTED) {
768 supportSearchRadius = m_kernel->computeCellBoundingRadius(id);
769 } else if (cellLocation == LevelSetCellLocation::NARROW_BAND_NEIGHBOUR) {
770 // Evaluate the bounding diameter of the smallest intersected face neighbour
771 supportSearchRadius = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
772 auto neighProcessor = [this, &supportSearchRadius](long neighId, int layer) {
773 BITPIT_UNUSED(layer);
774
775 // Discard neighbours that are not intersected
776 LevelSetCellLocation neighLocation = getCellLocation(neighId);
777 if (neighLocation != LevelSetCellLocation::NARROW_BAND_INTERSECTED) {
778 return false;
779 }
780
781 // Consider the bounding diameter of the smallest intersected neighbour
782 supportSearchRadius = std::min(2 * m_kernel->computeCellBoundingRadius(neighId), supportSearchRadius);
783
784 // Continue processing the other neighbours
785 return false;
786 };
787
788 const VolumeKernel &mesh = *(m_kernel->getMesh()) ;
789 mesh.processCellFaceNeighbours(id, 1, neighProcessor);
790
791 // Ad the bounding radius of the cell
792 supportSearchRadius += m_kernel->computeCellBoundingRadius(id);
793 } else {
794 supportSearchRadius = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
795 }
796 } else {
797 supportSearchRadius = searchRadius;
798 }
799
800 // Evaluate cell support
801 return _evalCellSupport(id, supportSearchRadius);
802 };
803
804 auto fallback = [] (long id)
805 {
806 BITPIT_UNUSED(id);
807
808 return levelSetDefaults::SUPPORT;
809 };
810
811 LevelSetField field = LevelSetField::SUPPORT;
812
813 long support;
814 if (searchRadius < std::numeric_limits<double>::max() && searchRadius != AUTOMATIC_SEARCH_RADIUS) {
815 // Evaluate the support from scratch
816 support = evalCellField<long>(field, id, evaluator, fallback);
817
818 // Update the cache if the support is valid
819 if (support >= 0) {
820 fillFieldCellCache(field, id, support);
821 }
822 } else {
823 // Evaluate the support
824 support = evalCellFieldCached<long>(field, id, evaluator, fallback);
825 }
826
827 return support;
828}

887
894int LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::_evalCellPart(long id) const
895{
896 long support = evalCellSupport(id);
897 const SurfUnstructured &surface = evalCellSurface(id);
898 int part = surface.getCell(support).getPID();
899
900 return part;
901}
902
909int LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::_evalPart(const std::array<double,3> &point) const
910{
911 long support = evalSupport(point);
912 const SurfUnstructured &surface = evalSurface(point);
913 int part = surface.getCell(support).getPID();
914
915 return part;
916}
917
924void LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::addVTKOutputData( LevelSetField field, const std::string &objectName)
925{
926 VTK &vtkWriter = this->m_kernel->getMesh()->getVTK() ;
927 std::string name = this->getVTKOutputDataName(field, objectName);
928
929 switch (field) {
930
931 case LevelSetField::SUPPORT:
932 vtkWriter.addData<long>( name, VTKFieldType::SCALAR, VTKLocation::CELL, this);
933 break;
934
935 case LevelSetField::PART:
936 vtkWriter.addData<int>( name, VTKFieldType::SCALAR, VTKLocation::CELL, this);
937 break;
938
939 case LevelSetField::NORMAL:
940 vtkWriter.addData<double>( name, VTKFieldType::VECTOR, VTKLocation::CELL, this);
941 break;
942
943 default:
944 LevelSetObject::addVTKOutputData(field, objectName);
945 break;
946
947 }
948}
949
956std::string LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::getVTKOutputFieldName( LevelSetField field) const
957{
958 switch (field) {
959
960 case LevelSetField::SUPPORT:
961 return "SupportId";
962
963 case LevelSetField::PART:
964 return "PartId";
965
966 case LevelSetField::NORMAL:
967 return "Normal";
968
969 default:
970 return LevelSetObject::getVTKOutputFieldName(field);
971
972 }
973}
974
984void LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::flushVTKOutputData(std::fstream &stream, VTKFormat format,
985 LevelSetField field) const
986{
987 switch (field) {
988
989 case LevelSetField::SUPPORT:
990 {
991 auto evaluator = [this] (long id) { return evalCellSupport(id); };
992 auto fallback = [] (long id) { BITPIT_UNUSED(id); return levelSetDefaults::SUPPORT; };
993 flushVTKOutputData<double>(stream, format, field, evaluator, fallback);
994 break;
995 }
996
997 case LevelSetField::PART:
998 {
999 auto evaluator = [this] (long id) { return evalCellPart(id); };
1000 auto fallback = [] (long id) { BITPIT_UNUSED(id); return levelSetDefaults::PART; };
1001 flushVTKOutputData<double>(stream, format, field, evaluator, fallback);
1002 break;
1003 }
1004
1005 case LevelSetField::NORMAL:
1006 {
1007 auto evaluator = [this] (long id) { return evalCellNormal(id, true); };
1008 auto fallback = [] (long id) { BITPIT_UNUSED(id); return levelSetDefaults::NORMAL; };
1009 flushVTKOutputData<double>(stream, format, field, evaluator, fallback);
1010 break;
1011 }
1012
1013 default:
1014 LevelSetObject::flushVTKOutputData(stream, format, field);
1015 break;
1016
1017 }
1018}
1019
1026int LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::getPart(long cellId) const
1027{
1028 return evalCellPart(cellId);
1029}
1030
1037std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::getNormal(long cellId) const
1038{
1039 return evalCellNormal(cellId, m_defaultSignedLevelSet);
1040}
1041
1048long LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::getSupport(long cellId) const
1049{
1050 return evalCellSupport(cellId);
1051}
1052
1059double LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::getSurfaceFeatureSize(long cellId) const
1060{
1061 long support = evalCellSupport(cellId);
1062 if (support < 0) {
1063 return (- levelSetDefaults::SIZE);
1064 }
1065
1066 const SurfUnstructured &surface = evalCellSurface(cellId);
1067
1068 return surface.evalCellSize(support);
1069}

1100{
1101 return evalSupport(point);
1102}
1103
1110double LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject::getSurfaceFeatureSize(const std::array<double,3> &point) const
1111{
1112 long support = evalSupport(point);
1113 if (support < 0) {
1114 return (- levelSetDefaults::SIZE);
1115 }
1116
1117 const SurfUnstructured &surface = evalSurface(point);
1118
1119 return surface.evalCellSize(support);
1120}

1234void LevelSetSegmentationObject::setSurface(std::unique_ptr<const SurfUnstructured> &&surface, double featureAngle, bool force){
1235 if (m_surfaceInfo) {
1236 // Check if replacing an existing surface is allowed
1237 if (!force) {
1238 throw std::runtime_error ("The surface can only be set once.");
1239 }
1240
1241 // Replace the surface
1242 m_surfaceInfo->setSurface(std::move(surface), featureAngle);
1243 } else {
1244 // Set surface
1245 //
1246 // Since this is the first time we set the surface, there is no need
1247 // to clear the caches.
1248 m_surfaceInfo = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo>(new LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo(std::move(surface), featureAngle));
1249 }
1250}

1268}

1283void LevelSetSegmentationObject::setSurface(const SurfUnstructured *surface, double featureAngle, bool force){
1284 if (m_surfaceInfo) {
1285 // Check if replacing an existing surface is allowed
1286 if (!force) {
1287 throw std::runtime_error ("The surface can only be set once.");
1288 }
1289
1290 // Replace the surface
1291 m_surfaceInfo->setSurface(surface, featureAngle);
1292 } else {
1293 // Set surface
1294 //
1295 // Since this is the first time we set the surface, there is no need
1296 // to clear the caches.
1297 m_surfaceInfo = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo>(new LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo(surface, featureAngle));
1298 }

1316
1327void LevelSetSegmentationObject::fillCellLocationCache()
1328{
1329 // Cartesian patches are handled separately
1330 if (dynamic_cast<LevelSetCartesianKernel*>(m_kernel)) {
1331 fillCartesianCellZoneCache();
1332 return;
1333 }
1334
1335 // All other patches are handled with the base method.
1336 LevelSetObject::fillCellLocationCache();
1337}
1338
1351void LevelSetSegmentationObject::fillCellLocationCache(const std::vector<adaption::Info> &adaptionData)
1352{
1353 // Cartesian patches are handled separately
1354 //
1355 // Update is not implemented for Cartesian patches, the cells that should be inserted in
1356 // the cache will be evaluated considering all the mash not just the elements newly added.
1357 if (dynamic_cast<LevelSetCartesianKernel*>(m_kernel)) {
1358 fillCartesianCellZoneCache();
1359 return;
1360 }
1361
1362 // All other patches are handled with the base method
1363 LevelSetObject::fillCellLocationCache(adaptionData);
1364}
1365
1377void LevelSetSegmentationObject::fillCartesianCellZoneCache()
1378{
1379 // The function needs a Cartesian kernel
1380 const LevelSetCartesianKernel *cartesianKernel = dynamic_cast<LevelSetCartesianKernel*>(m_kernel);
1381 if (!dynamic_cast<LevelSetCartesianKernel*>(m_kernel)) {
1382 throw std::runtime_error("The function needs a Cartesian kernels.");
1383 }
1384
1385 // Get mesh information
1386 const VolCartesian &mesh = *(cartesianKernel->getMesh() ) ;
1387 int meshDimension = mesh.getDimension();
1388 long nCells = mesh.getCellCount();
1389
1390 std::array<double,3> meshMinPoint;
1391 std::array<double,3> meshMaxPoint;
1392 mesh.getBoundingBox(meshMinPoint, meshMaxPoint) ;
1393
1394 // Get surface information
1395 const SurfUnstructured &surface = getSurface();
1396
1397 // Initialize process list
1398 //
1399 // Process list is initialized with cells that are certainly inside the
1400 // narrow band. Those cells are the ones that contain the vertices of the
1401 // segments or the intersection between the segments and the bounding box
1402 // of the patch.
1403 std::unordered_set<long> processList;
1404
1405 std::vector<std::array<double,3>> intersectionPoints;
1406 std::vector<std::array<double,3>> segmentVertexCoords;
1407 for (const Cell &segment : surface.getCells()) {
1408 // Get segment info
1409 //
1410 // Since vertex information will be passed to the CG module, we need to get the
1411 // vertices in the proper order.
1412 ConstProxyVector<long> segmentVertexIds = surface.getFacetOrderedVertexIds(segment);
1413 std::size_t nSegmentVertices = segmentVertexIds.size();
1414
1415 // Get segment coordinates
1416 segmentVertexCoords.resize(nSegmentVertices);
1417 surface.getVertexCoords(nSegmentVertices, segmentVertexIds.data(), segmentVertexCoords.data());
1418
1419 // Add to the process list the cells that contain the vertices of the
1420 // segment or the intersection between the segment and the bounding box
1421 // of the patch.
1422 int nInnerVertices = 0;
1423 for (const std::array<double,3> &vertexPoint : segmentVertexCoords) {
1424 long cellId = mesh.locatePoint(vertexPoint);
1425 if (cellId < 0) {
1426 continue;
1427 }
1428
1429 processList.insert(cellId);
1430 ++nInnerVertices;
1431 }
1432
1433 if (nInnerVertices == 0) {
1434 if (CGElem::intersectBoxPolygon(meshMinPoint, meshMaxPoint, segmentVertexCoords, false, true, true, intersectionPoints, meshDimension)) {
1435 for (const std::array<double,3> &intersectionPoint : intersectionPoints){
1436 long cellId = mesh.locateClosestCell(intersectionPoint);
1437 processList.insert(cellId);
1438 }
1439 }
1440 }
1441 }
1442
1443 // Get cache for zone identification
1444 CellCacheCollection::ValueCache<char> *locationCache = getCellCache<char>(m_cellLocationCacheId);
1445
1446 // Cells with an unknown region are in the bulk
1447 for (long cellId = 0; cellId < nCells; ++cellId) {
1448 locationCache->insertEntry(cellId, static_cast<char>(LevelSetCellLocation::UNKNOWN));
1449 }
1450
1451 // Start filling the list of cells within the narrow band
1452 //
1453 // The initial process list is gradually expanded considering all the neighbours
1454 // inside the narrow band.
1455 std::vector<long> intersectedCellIds;
1456 std::vector<bool> alreadyProcessed(nCells, false);
1457 while (!processList.empty()) {
1458 // Get the cell to process
1459 long cellId = *(processList.begin());
1460 processList.erase(processList.begin());
1461
1462 // Skip cells already processed
1463 if (alreadyProcessed[cellId]) {
1464 continue;
1465 }
1466 alreadyProcessed[cellId] = true;
1467
1468 // Fill location cache for cells geometrically inside the narrow band
1469 LevelSetCellLocation cellLocation = fillCellGeometricNarrowBandLocationCache(cellId);
1470
1471 // Track intersected cells
1472 if (cellLocation == LevelSetCellLocation::NARROW_BAND_INTERSECTED) {
1473 intersectedCellIds.push_back(cellId);
1474 }
1475
1476 // Add unprocessed neighbours of cells inside the narrow band to the process list
1477 if (cellLocation != LevelSetCellLocation::UNKNOWN) {
1478 auto neighProcessor = [&processList, &alreadyProcessed](long neighId, int layer) {
1479 BITPIT_UNUSED(layer);
1480
1481 // Skip neighbours already processed
1482 if (alreadyProcessed[neighId]) {
1483 return false;
1484 }
1485
1486 // Update the process list
1487 processList.insert(neighId);
1488
1489 // Continue processing the other neighbours
1490 return false;
1491 };
1492
1493 mesh.processCellFaceNeighbours(cellId, 1, neighProcessor);
1494 }
1495 }
1496
1497 // Identify neighbours of cells that intersect the surface
1498 for (std::size_t cellId : intersectedCellIds) {
1499 // Process face neighbours
1500 auto neighProcessor = [this, &locationCache](long neighId, int layer) {
1501 BITPIT_UNUSED(layer);
1502
1503 // Skip neighbours whose region has already been identified
1504 if (getCellLocation(neighId) != LevelSetCellLocation::UNKNOWN) {
1505 return false;
1506 }
1507
1508 // The neighbour is inside the narrow band
1509 locationCache->insertEntry(neighId, static_cast<char>(LevelSetCellLocation::NARROW_BAND_NEIGHBOUR));
1510
1511 // Continue processing the other neighbours
1512 return false;
1513 };
1514
1515 mesh.processCellFaceNeighbours(cellId, 1, neighProcessor);
1516 }
1517
1518 // Cells with an unknown region are in the bulk
1519 for (long cellId = 0; cellId < nCells; ++cellId) {
1520 CellCacheCollection::ValueCache<char>::Entry locationCacheEntry = locationCache->findEntry(cellId);
1521 if (*locationCacheEntry == static_cast<char>(LevelSetCellLocation::UNKNOWN)) {
1522 locationCache->insertEntry(cellId, static_cast<char>(LevelSetCellLocation::BULK));
1523 }
1524 }
1525
1526#if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
1527 // Exchange ghost data
1528 if (mesh.isPartitioned()) {
1529 std::unique_ptr<DataCommunicator> dataCommunicator = m_kernel->createDataCommunicator();
1530 startCellCacheExchange(mesh.getGhostCellExchangeSources(), m_cellLocationCacheId, dataCommunicator.get());
1531 completeCellCacheExchange(mesh.getGhostCellExchangeTargets(), m_cellLocationCacheId, dataCommunicator.get());
1532 }
1533#endif
1534}
1535
1550LevelSetCellLocation LevelSetSegmentationObject::fillCellGeometricNarrowBandLocationCache(long id)
1551{
1552 // Early return if the cell is geometrically outside the narrow band
1553 double searchRadius = std::max(m_kernel->computeCellBoundingRadius(id), m_narrowBandSize);
1554 long cellSupport = evalCellSupport(id, searchRadius);
1555 if (cellSupport < 0) {
1556 return LevelSetCellLocation::UNKNOWN;
1557 }
1558
1559 // Evaluate levelset value
1560 std::array<double,3> cellCentroid = m_kernel->computeCellCentroid(id);
1561
1562 double cellCacheValue = _evalValue(cellCentroid, cellSupport, CELL_CACHE_IS_SIGNED);
1563 double cellUnsigendValue = std::abs(cellCacheValue);
1564
1565 // Update the cell location cache
1566 //
1567 // First we need to check if the cell intersectes the surface, and only if it
1568 // deosn't we should check if its distance is lower than the narrow band size.
1569 LevelSetCellLocation cellLocation = LevelSetCellLocation::UNKNOWN;
1570 if (_intersectSurface(id, cellUnsigendValue, CELL_LOCATION_INTERSECTION_MODE) == LevelSetIntersectionStatus::TRUE) {
1571 cellLocation = LevelSetCellLocation::NARROW_BAND_INTERSECTED;
1572 } else if (cellUnsigendValue <= m_narrowBandSize) {
1573 cellLocation = LevelSetCellLocation::NARROW_BAND_DISTANCE;
1574 }
1575 assert(cellLocation != LevelSetCellLocation::UNKNOWN);
1576
1577 CellCacheCollection::ValueCache<char> *locationCache = getCellCache<char>(m_cellLocationCacheId);
1578 locationCache->insertEntry(id, static_cast<char>(cellLocation));
1579
1580 // Fill the cache of the evaluated fields
1581 //
1582 // Now that the cell location has been identified, we can fill the cache of the
1583 // evaluated fields.
1584 fillFieldCellCache(LevelSetField::SUPPORT, id, cellSupport);
1585 fillFieldCellCache(LevelSetField::VALUE, id, cellCacheValue);
1586
1587 // Return the location
1588 return cellLocation;
1589}
1590
1597const SurfUnstructured & LevelSetSegmentationObject::_evalCellSurface(long id) const
1598{
1599 BITPIT_UNUSED(id);
1600
1601 return getSurface();
1602}

1743std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationObject::_evalNormal(const std::array<double,3> &point, bool signedLevelSet) const

1748}
1749
1757short LevelSetSegmentationObject::_evalSign(const std::array<double,3> &point, long support) const
1758{
1759 // Throw an error if the support is not valid
1760 if (support < 0) {
1761 if (empty()) {
1762 return levelSetDefaults::SIGN;
1763 }
1764
1765 throw std::runtime_error("Unable to evaluate the sign: the support is not valid.");
1766 }
1767
1768 LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::SegmentConstIterator supportItr = getSurface().getCellConstIterator(support);
1769
1770 return evalValueSign(m_surfaceInfo->evalDistance(point, supportItr, true));
1771}
1772
1781double LevelSetSegmentationObject::_evalValue(const std::array<double,3> &point, long support,
1782 bool signedLevelSet) const
1783{
1784 // Early return if the support is not valid
1785 //
1786 // With an invalid support, only the unsigend levelset can be evaluated.
1787 if (support < 0) {
1788 if (!signedLevelSet || empty()) {
1789 return levelSetDefaults::VALUE;
1790 }
1791
1792 throw std::runtime_error("With an invalid support, only the unsigend levelset can be evaluated.");
1793 }
1794
1795 // Evaluate the distance of the point from the surface
1796 LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::SegmentConstIterator supportItr = getSurface().getCellConstIterator(support);
1797 double distance = m_surfaceInfo->evalDistance(point, supportItr, signedLevelSet);
1798
1799 // Early return if the point lies on the surface
1800 if (evalValueSign(distance) == 0) {
1801 return 0.;
1802 }
1803
1804 // Evaluate levelset value
1805 double value;
1806 if (signedLevelSet) {
1807 value = distance;
1808 } else {
1809 value = std::abs(distance);
1810 }
1811
1812 return value;
1813}
1814
1823std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationObject::_evalGradient(const std::array<double,3> &point, long support,
1824 bool signedLevelSet) const
1825{
1826 // Early return if the support is not valid
1827 //
1828 // With an invalid support, only the unsigend levelset can be evaluated.
1829 if (support < 0) {
1830 if (!signedLevelSet || empty()) {
1831 return levelSetDefaults::GRADIENT;
1832 }
1833
1834 throw std::runtime_error("With an invalid support, only the unsigend levelset can be evaluated.");
1835 }
1836
1837 // Evaluate the distance of the point from the surface
1838 LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::SegmentConstIterator supportItr = getSurface().getCellConstIterator(support);
1839 double distance = m_surfaceInfo->evalDistance(point, supportItr, signedLevelSet);
1840
1841 // Early return if the point lies on the surface
1842 if (evalValueSign(distance) == 0) {
1843 if (signedLevelSet) {
1844 return m_surfaceInfo->evalNormal(point, supportItr);
1845 } else {
1846 return {{0., 0., 0.}};
1847 }
1848 }
1849
1850 // Evaluate levelset gradient
1851 std::array<double,3> gradient = m_surfaceInfo->evalDistanceVector(point, supportItr) / distance;
1852
1853 return gradient;
1854}
1855
1862long LevelSetSegmentationObject::_evalSupport(const std::array<double,3> &point) const
1863{
1864 return _evalSupport(point, std::numeric_limits<double>::max());
1865}
1866
1875long LevelSetSegmentationObject::_evalSupport(const std::array<double,3> &point, double searchRadius) const
1876{
1877 long closestSegmentId;
1878 double closestDistance;
1879 m_surfaceInfo->getSearchTree().findPointClosestCell(point, searchRadius, &closestSegmentId, &closestDistance);
1880
1881 return closestSegmentId;
1882}
1883
1892std::array<double,3> LevelSetSegmentationObject::_evalNormal(const std::array<double,3> &point, long support,
1893 bool signedLevelSet) const
1894{
1895 // Early return if the support is not valid
1896 //
1897 // With an invalid support, only the unsigend levelset can be evaluated.
1898 if (support < 0) {
1899 if (!signedLevelSet || empty()) {
1900 return levelSetDefaults::NORMAL;
1901 }
1902
1903 throw std::runtime_error("With an invalid support, only the unsigend levelset can be evaluated.");
1904 }
1905
1906 // Evaluate the normal
1907 //
1908 // If an unsigned evaluation is requested, the orientation of the surface should be discarded
1909 // and in order to have a normal that is agnostic with respect the two sides of the surface.
1910 LevelSetSegmentationSurfaceInfo::SegmentConstIterator supportItr = getSurface().getCellConstIterator(support);
1911 std::array<double,3> normal = m_surfaceInfo->evalNormal(point, supportItr);
1912 if (!signedLevelSet) {
1913 normal *= static_cast<double>(evalSign(point));
1914 }
1915
1916 return normal;
1917}
1918
1925double LevelSetSegmentationObject::getMinSurfaceFeatureSize() const {
1926
1927 const SurfUnstructured &surface = getSurface();
1928
1929 bool minimumValid = false;
1930 double minimumSize = levelSetDefaults::SIZE;
1931 for (const Cell &cell : surface.getCells()) {
1932 double segmentSize = surface.evalCellSize(cell.getId());
1933 if (segmentSize < 0) {
1934 continue;
1935 }
1936
1937 minimumValid = true;
1938 minimumSize = std::min(segmentSize, minimumSize);
1939 }
1940
1941 if (!minimumValid) {
1942 minimumSize = - levelSetDefaults::SIZE;
1943 }
1944
1945 return minimumSize;
1946}
1947
1954double LevelSetSegmentationObject::getMaxSurfaceFeatureSize() const {
1955
1956 const SurfUnstructured &surface = getSurface();
1957
1958 double maximumSize = - levelSetDefaults::SIZE;
1959 for (const Cell &cell : surface.getCells()) {
1960 double segmentSize = surface.evalCellSize(cell.getId());
1961 maximumSize = std::max(segmentSize, maximumSize);
1962 }
1963
1964 return maximumSize;
1965}

1985LevelSetBooleanObject<LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject>::LevelSetBooleanObject( int id, LevelSetBooleanOperation op, const std::vector<const LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject *> &sourceObjects )
1986 : LevelSetBooleanBaseObject<LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject>(id, op, sourceObjects) {
1987}

2018
2025int LevelSetBooleanObject<LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject>::_evalCellPart(long id) const
2026{
2027 return getCellReferenceObject(id)->evalCellPart(id);
2028}
2029
2037std::array<double,3> LevelSetBooleanObject<LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject>::_evalCellNormal(long id, bool signedLevelSet) const
2038{
2039 return _evalCellFunction<std::array<double,3>>(id, signedLevelSet, [&id, signedLevelSet] (const LevelSetBooleanResult<LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject> &result)
2040 {
2041 const LevelSetSegmentationBaseObject *resultObject = result.getObject();
2042 if ( !resultObject ) {
2043 return levelSetDefaults::NORMAL;
2044 }
2045
2046 std::array<double,3> normal = resultObject->evalCellNormal(id, signedLevelSet);
2047 if (signedLevelSet) {
2048 normal *= static_cast<double>(result.getObjectSign());
2049 }
2050
2051 return normal;
2052 });
2053}
